thread.title: Arne Duncan, Obama's education secretary, stepping down
thread.title_full: Arne Duncan, Obama's education secretary, stepping down

author: Dave Boyer
title: Arne Duncan, Obama's education secretary, stepping down
text:
Education Secretary Arne Duncan stepping down Education Secretary Arne Duncan speaks in Arlington, Va., on May 12, 2015. (Associated Press) **FILE** more > By Dave Boyer - The Washington Times - Updated: 11:35 a.m. on Friday, October 2, 2015 
Education Secretary Arne Duncan, one of President Obama’s longest-serving Cabinet members, is expected to announce his resignation Friday afternoon. 
The president has scheduled the announcement for the State Dining Room in the White House, where it’s expected he will also announce his intention to nominate deputy Education Secretary John King to take over the post. 
Mr. Duncan, formerly CEO of the Chicago public schools, has been with the administration since the start in 2009. 
The White House said Mr. Obama also will take questions from the press at the afternoon event. The president has yet to address publicly this week’s development of Russian airstrikes in support of the Syrian regime of President Bashar Assad.
